column9: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Unique Users)
column10: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through unpaid distribution. (Unique Users)
column11: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Unique Users)
column12: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Total Count)
column13: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's posts entered a person's screen through unpaid distribution. (Total Count)
column14: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Total Count)
column15: Lifetime: The number of unique people who engaged in certain ways with your Page post, for example by commenting on, liking, sharing, or clicking upon particular elements of the post. (Unique Users)
column16: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting that clicked anywhere in your post on News Feed. (Unique Users)
column17: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in your post on News Feed from the user that matched the audience targeting on it. (Total Count)
column18: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post. (Unique Users)
column19: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post. (Total Count)
column20: Lifetime: The number of impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column21: Lifetime: The number of people who saw your Page post because they've liked your Page (Unique Users)
column22: Lifetime: The number of paid impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column23: Lifetime: The number of people who like your Page and who saw your Page post in an ad or sponsored story. (Unique Users)
column24: Lifetime: The number of people who have liked your Page and clicked anywhere in your posts. (Unique Users)
column25: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column26: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column27: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column28: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column29: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column30: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column31: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column32: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column33: Lifetime: Average time video viewed (Total Count)
column34: Lifetime: Length of a video post (Total Count)
column35: Lifetime: The number of unique people who created a story about your Page post by interacting with it. (Unique Users)
column38: Lifetime: The number of stories created about your Page post, by action type. (Total Count)
column41: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting on the post that clicked anywhere in the post on News Feed, by type. (Unique Users)
column45: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in the post on News Feed from users that matched the audience targeting on the post, by type. (Total Count)
column49: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Total Count)
column51: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Unique Users)

column3:
Thanks Dazed and Confused Magazine!

"I co-wrote this series with two other gay men of colour – KB Woodson and Zak Payne. We all agreed that we wanted to touch on the rawness of the queer community which meant we had to tackle drugs. We also wanted to push what it looked like to be a person of colour in a white-dominated workplace, which is so important and something so many of us can relate to. We wanted to portray it in a way that highlights how awkward and uncomfortable it can be for us in those situations." - Vincent Martell, co-writer and director of #DamagedGoods
Thanks Queerty!!

Barely surviving the city of Chicago, four messy young adults will experience a complete loss of self-identity, which propels them onto a path of uncertainty. In Damaged Goods from Vincent Martell and VAM, the nuanced characters, their lives, and the situations they get themselves into reflect a gritty creative community we rarely see played out on screen. 

#DamagedGoodswebseries will be screened at Screening: Open TV Tonight and have a Q&A with creator Vincent Martell and executive producers Sam Bailey and Fatima Asghar (of #BrownGirlsTV !). 

Presale tickets are no longer available but if you join the waitlist and arrive early enough, you will get in. Waitlist is first come first serve. Click our link in bio for more info. Also please note that the MCA staff manages the waitlist ;) love y’all. https://bit.ly/2HSE1Zs

If you can't make it, catch them at the kickoff of #OTVWednesdays 
OTV Presents: Damaged Goods & FOBia on 4/10 where we will screen the series and the pilot of FOBia Series

Like the main character of her show Quare Life Web Series, M Shelly Conner's loves to be dapper! 

"The … first time I wore a bowtie, it did not imbue me with masculinity. I did not become butch, stud, or any other masculine-male identity. It did, however, provide a buffer for me to experience some of the liberties attributed to the masculine. My mannerisms and behaviors were no longer regulated by my style of dress."
Sunday vibes.
Congrats Andre Perez, creator of Been T/here!

#OTVTonight the official kickoff of our fourth cycle of programming, is coming soon! 

Advance free tickets are no longer available, but the waitlist is first come first serve so show up early and you should get in.

We will be screening the super trailer which show all of our releases this cycle, and selections from Damaged Goods FOBia Series The Right Swipe and #GoodEnoughtv with with brief interviews their respective creators. 

There will also be live alternating DJ sets from Hijo Pródigo. Learn more on the event page!

Thank you WCIU for talking to The Right Swipe and FOBia Series teams about their premieres! Both shows will screen at the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago April 4 at 5:30pm! Get there early and should get seats! #weareotv

Pop Culture Collab profiles why we do what we do! 

"The relatively low economic barrier to producing web series versus industry pilots gets emerging 'creators in front of an audience, feedback from the audience, and builds the brand of the artist while building the audience,' says OTV founder Aymar Jean Christian, Ph.D. The creators also have more than one season, as opposed to just one pilot, to hone their projects. The result when it lands at a network is that 'these shows will show up in long-form more fully realized and more likely to be artistically cohesive and therefore last multiple seasons.'"

This is coming up on Tuesday! (And then again the following Tuesday)

Join us in creating the future you want to live in. Our Head of Community Jenna Anast is leading an intentional workshop where participants will be creating Brave Space Agreements and guidelines for all OTV affiliated workshops, events, gatherings, screenings, communications, etc.

Make sure you RSVP: https://bit.ly/2Uxfhtm 
Get more info on the event page.

#OTVWednesdays is coming soon to a theater near you! Make sure you RSVP to catch the free premieres of all these amazing programs: 

April 10: OTV Presents: Damaged Goods & FOBia
April 17: OTV Presents: Low Strung & Border'd
April 24: OTV Presents: Freaky Phyllis & Renee

Once we kick off our season with Screening: Open TV Tonight on April 4th, every following Wednesday in April (10-24), May (8-29), and June(5-12) we'll be premiering new content in Chicago and online. 

Check out the full list of premieres at http://bit.ly/otvevents.
Tune in LIVE today 4:05pm for the premiere of Dr. Every Woman x #PrEP4Love's #CatchDesire Visual EP!

Honor #nwghaad with these amazing original songs and visuals by @dreverywoman ! Watch all three videos at  https://www.weareo.tv/presents/catchdesire
・・・
SURPRISE!!! We’ve been cooking up a special lil something, something with @dreverywoman 💙💙💙.
.
.
.
Today is National Women and Girls HIV/AIDS Awareness Day (#NWGHAAD) and we’re so happy to be releasing the CATCH DESIRE VISUAL EP, featuring three original songs & visuals written and recorded by Dr. Every Woman. Each song aims to uplift the narratives and experiences of sexually liberated black women while also promoting the value of #PReP through witty remakes of all-time-favorites “Computer Love” by Zapp, “Shoop” by Salt-N-Peppa and “Anaconda” by Nicki Minaj. .
.
.
Watch all three videos at OTV - Open Television or AIDS Foundation of Chicago! . LINK IN BIO.
.
.
.

Find healing and community through movement in the “Let’s Go for a Twirl” collection of #otvplayback SISTERHOOD. It features The Furies by @kingisafink , Darling Shear by @diaquiri , and Futurewomen by @honeypotchicago . Watch now with the link in bio.

#OTVplayback is a weekly playlist of programs that we’ve released over the past three years, curated with love and bit of sass to get you through #womenshistorymonth

Find healing and community through movement in  Let’s Go for a Twirl, the third collection of the #OTVplayback SISTERHOOD playlist. It features The Furies by King is a Fink Productions, Darling Shear by Diana Quiñones Rivera, and Futurewomen by Honey Pot Performance.

#OTVplayback is a weekly playlist of programs that we’ve released over the past three years, curated with love and bit of sass to get you through living in a patrirchal society. Sign up for the weareo.tv/OTVprogram to receive info about #OTVplayback.

This one goes out to the riders you can call crying in the middle of the night, who will pull up with a bottle of wine and your favorite frozen pizza post-breakup, who will let you rant about your boss for an hour. 

Invite them over to watch "A Shoulder To Lean On" featuring #BrownGirlstv, You're So Talented, and #Seedsseries. 

A Shoulder to Lean on is part 2 of #OTVplayback, a weekly playlist of programs that we’ve released over the past three years, curated with love and bit of sass to get you through whatever life throws your way. Sign up for the weareo.tv/OTVprogram to receive info about OTVplayback.

OTV board member Allie Stephens went on an incredible journey back to the place she grew up for the first time as a transwoman! WTTW - Chicago PBS followed as she reunites with an old friend ❤️ #weareotv

Happy #womenshistorymonth ! 

The love bug may come and go, but your girls are forever. Hit up the group chat and settle in with If You Wanna Be My Lover collection featuring Geeta's Guide To Moving On by Puja Mohindra , YOGMA by Karla Huffman, and the T - Web Series by Bea Cordelia and Daniel Kyri Madison. 

If You Wanna Be My Lover is part 1 of the SISTERHOOD #OTVplayback playlist celebrating #womenshistorymonth. #OTVplayback is a weekly playlist of programs that we’ve released over the past three years, curated with love and bit of sass to get you through the weekend. Sign up for the #OTVprogram to receive info about OTVplayback: weareo.tv/program
